Giliran SMPN 1 Kota Bekasi Deklarasi Sekolah Ramah Anak
07 Nov 2019, 12:21 by Riesty Yusnilaningsih
BEKASI, (PR).- SMPN 1 Kota Bekasi mendeklarasikan diri sebagai sekolah ramah anak. Deklarasi yang diselenggarakan Kamis 7 November 2019, diramaikan dengan serangkaian acara yang digelar di luar ruang kelas.
Kepala SMPN 1 Kota Bekasi Euis Siti Halimah mengatakan, deklarasi ini merupakan jawaban atas himbauan Kementerian Pendidikan dan Kebudayaan yang ditindaklanjuti dengan edaran Dinas Pendidikan Kota Bekasi.
"Kami bersemangat menjadi sekolah ramah anak demi menyediakan lingkungan yang mendukung perkembangan karakter anak," ucap Euis.
Pada hari pertama mendeklarasikan diri sebagai sekolah ramah anak, SMPN 1 Kota Bekasi memulai rangkaian acara dengan penyambutan kedatangan siswa oleh para guru. Lalu guru bersama siswa memperagakan senam germas, kesiagaan akan bencana, mempraktikkan permainan tradisional, menyanyikan yel-yel ramah anak, serta deklarasi kesiapan menjadi sekolah anak yang dibacakan bersama-sama.
"Kami juga memiliki tim sekolah ramah anak yang memastikan kegiatan yang terlaksana di sekolah tidak bertentangan dengan kaidah ramah anak," katanya.
Salah satu program sekolah ramah anak yang akan diterapkan di SMPN 1 Kota Bekasi ialah pembatasan penggunaan telefon genggam di kalangan siswa. Selama jam pelajaran, telefon genggam siswa akan dikumpulkan dan baru dikembalikan saat pulang sekolah.
"Bukan pelarangan, tapi pembatasan. Aturannya pun masih fleksibel karena saat ada pelajaran yang memerlukan akses informasi ke internet, siswa boleh menggunakan telefon genggamnya," katanya.***

Turning to SMPN 1 Bekasi City Declaration of Child Friendly Schools
Nov 7 2019, 12:21 by Riesty Yusnilaningsih
BEKASI, (PR) .- SMPN 1 Bekasi City declared itself as a child-friendly school. The declaration, which was held on Thursday 7 November 2019, was enlivened by a series of events held outside the classroom.
Head of Bekasi City SMPN 1 Euis Siti Halimah said, this declaration was an answer to the call of the Ministry of Education and Culture which was followed up with a circular from the Bekasi City Education Office.
"We are excited to be a child-friendly school to provide an environment that supports the development of children's character," said Euis.
On the first day declaring themselves to be a child-friendly school, SMPN 1 Bekasi City began a series of events by welcoming the arrival of students by the teachers. Then the teacher and the students demonstrate the Germas Gymnastics, disaster preparedness, practice traditional games, sing child-friendly chants, and the declaration of readiness to be a children's school that is read together.
"We also have a child-friendly school team that ensures that the activities carried out at school do not conflict with the child-friendly rules," he said.
One of the child friendly school programs that will be implemented at SMPN 1 Bekasi City is to limit the use of mobile phones among students. During class hours, students' cellphones will be collected and returned only after school.
"Not a ban, but a limitation. The rules are still flexible because when there are lessons that require access to information to the internet, students may use their mobile phones," he said. ***
